author: Xavi Segura
title: Earth records its second warmest April ever, approaching a record for 2024
text:
Earth records its second warmest April ever, approaching a record for 2024
The latest Copernicus report also confirms that the global average temperature remains above the fateful 1.5Â°C.
BarcelonaThis April was the second warmest on record worldwide. The average monthly global temperature was 14.96Â°C, just 0.07Â°C below the record set in April 2024 and 0.6Â°C above the average for this month in the reference period (1991â€“2020).
This is the conclusion of the monthly report from the European Copernicus programme's climate change service, published Thursday, which also highlights that this April the average temperature was 1.51Â°C above the estimated average for the pre-industrial period (1850â€“1900). This is the 21st of the last 22 years in which the global average temperature has exceeded the fateful 1.5Â°C above pre-industrial levels.
"Continuous monitoring of climate developments is an essential tool for understanding and responding to the changes underway in our climate system," explains Samantha Burgess, climate strategy lead at the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMW), in the report.
As for Europe, this was the sixth warmest April in the entire historical series. The average temperature across the continent was 9.38Â°C, 1.01Â°C above the average for the 1991-2020 period. Thermometers were clearly warmer in parts of eastern Europe, western Russia, and Norway, among others. However, towards the southeast of the continent, temperatures were colder than normal.
Outside of Europe, temperatures have been particularly warm in areas such as eastern Russia, much of central and western Asia, North America, and parts of Antarctica. In contrast, temperatures in parts of South and northeast America and parts of Greenland have been below average.
The second warmest April on record, also at sea.
Regarding sea surface water, the global average temperature was 20.89Â°C this past month. This makes April the second warmest on record for seas and oceans around the world, just 0.15Â°C below last year's record-breaking April. Significantly, the record heat levels were set in large areas of the northeast Atlantic. Much of the Mediterranean Sea also saw very warm temperatures, but below the records recorded in March, according to Copernicus data.
Regarding Arctic sea ice extent, this April was 3% below average, the sixth lowest monthly extent for an April in 47 years of satellite records. This figure comes after four months of record-low monthly values for the time of year. Meanwhile, Antarctic sea ice extent has fallen 10% below average this past month, the tenth lowest figure on record for an April.
As for precipitation in Europe, this April it has remained above average in much of the southern part of the continent, particularly in the Alps, where rainfall has caused flooding, landslides and avalanches, as well as heavy snowfall. Elsewhere, rainfall has been abundant and has caused problems in several parts of the Americas, southern Africa, northern Australia, and central and eastern Russia.

author: Katherine Hamilton
title: Donald Trump: â€˜Democrats Really the Radical Onesâ€™ on Abortion
text:
Former President Donald Trump called out Democrats, including Democrat presidential nominee Kamala Harris and her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D), for being abortion extremists.
Trump, the Republican presidential nominee , made the comment during a Thursday press conference at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach, Florida.
â€œThe Democrats are really the radical ones on this. They are the ones who do abortions [through] the eighth and ninth month â€” and even after birth,â€ the 45th president said.
Trump compared Walz to pro-abortion former Virginia Gov. Ralph Northam (D), who in 2019 made controversial comments about a bill he supported that w ould have allowed women in his state to request an abortion, even as they are about to give birth.
Appearing as a guest on WTOP-FM, Northam said the fierce reaction to the bill was â€œreally blown out of proportion.â€
Asked about a woman requesting abortion at the moment of childbirth, he responded:
When we talk about third-trimester abortions, these are done with the consent of obviously the mother, with the consent of the physicianâ€”more than one physician, by the wayâ€”and itâ€™s done in cases where there may be severe deformities. There may be a fetus thatâ€™s non-viable.
Northam added:
If a mother is in labor, I can tell you exactly what would happen. The infant would be delivered. The infant would be kept comfortable. The infant would be resuscitated if thatâ€™s what the mother and the family desired, and then a discussion would ensue between the physicians and the mother.
Northam later said his comments were â€œmischaracterizedâ€ by the media, but he refused to recant .
VA gov on abortion this morning:
â€œIf a mother is in laborâ€¦the infant would be delivered. The infant would be kept comfortable. The infant would be resuscitated if thatâ€™s what the mother and the family desired, and then a discussion would ensue between the physicians & mother" pic.twitter.com/cc15pVLjIQ
â€” Caleb Hull (@CalebJHull) January 30, 2019
â€œThis guy agrees with that,â€ Trump said of Walz.
Walz has described himself as so pro-abortion, that even former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) suggested he â€œtone it down.â€
Gov. Tim Walz is so extreme on abortion that Nancy Pelosi once told him that he needs to â€œtone it downâ€ & be more moderate.
Donâ€™t vote for the ticket that will allow babies to die up until the moment of birth, and in some cases, even after birth. pic.twitter.com/FjtlEepfPg
â€” Kristan Hawkins (@KristanHawkins) August 6, 2024
Recent reports citing Minnesota Department of Health data have revealed that at least eight babies in his state have been born alive in botched abortions during his time as governor. None of the babies appeared to receive life-preserving care, and it â€œdoes not appear that any of the babies born alive in botched abortions survived,â€ The Daily Signal reported.
Trump was ðŸ’¯% correct. Post-birth abortion is real and Harris-Walz support it. At least 5 babies were born alive after botched abortions and left to die under Walzâ€™s watch. Two of these struggling babies were given â€œcomfort careâ€ instead of medical care allegedly in violation ofâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/OMrwWaK0NU
â€” Roger Severino (@RogerSeverino_) August 6, 2024
According to the report, Walz later repealed a 2015 Minnesota law in 2023 requiring the state to report whether abortions resulted in the live birth of a baby, what actions were taken to preserve the life of that baby, and whether the baby survived. He also stripped â€œthe stateâ€™s requirement that measure be taken to preserve the babyâ€™s â€˜life and healthâ€™ and merely replacing it with a nebulous requirement for â€˜care,â€â€˜ the report continues.
In January of 2023, Walz made Minnesota the first in the nation to codify abortion via legislative action after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade and sent the issue of abortion back to individual states and their elected representatives, Breitbart News reported at the time.
Walz previously served in the House of Representatives from 2007 to 2019, where he received a zero percent pro-life score from National Right to Life. In 2018, he accidentally voted in favor of a bill that would have protected babies who survived botched abortions. He quickly put out a statement apologizing for his mistake.
Accidentally voted for HR4712 todayâ€â™‚ï¸. It was an honest mistake. I meant to vote NO, as I did on an identical bill last Congress. My apologies for the confusion. I'll keep fighting for women's access to health care. #PatientsOverPolitics
My statement correcting the record: pic.twitter.com/kigO0PyZbE
â€” Fmr. Rep. Tim Walz (@RepTimWalz) January 19, 2018
â€œBetween [Harris] and him, thereâ€™s never been anything like this,â€ Trump said.
Trump also reiterated his position that abortion laws should be left up to individual states, and said he supports exceptions for rape, incest, and the life of the mother.
â€œEverybody wanted it back in the states, and I did that,â€ he said, referring to his nomination of three conservative leaning Supreme Court justices who ultimately played a role in overturning Roe v. Wade , a 1973 decision which invented a constitutional right to abortion.
â€œNow the states are voting. And frankly, some of the votes areâ€¦much more liberal than you would think,â€ he said in reference to abortion ballot measures going before voters across the United States. â€œOhio, they had a big vote, and it turned out to be a much more liberal standing than people would have thought. Kansas, the same thing . Then you have Texas and other places where it may be different.â€
Trump did remark that he believes â€œthe abortion issue has been very much tampered down.â€ Recent polling has shown that despite Harris making abortion the top issue of her campaign â€” much like President Joe Biden or even more so â€” abortion is not a top-five issue for voters.
â€œI think that abortion has become much less of an issue. I think itâ€™s actually going to be a very small issue,â€ he said.
Katherine Hamilton is a political reporter for Breitbart News. You can follow her on X @thekat_hamilton .
2024 Election Health Politics 2024 Presidential Election Abortion Donald Trump Kamala Harris late-term abortion Palm Beach Tim Walz unborn babies

Las lluvias intensas han causado que los niveles de los rÃ­os y arroyos suban rÃ¡pidamente, aumentando el riesgo de inundaciones en Ã¡reas de baja altitud y de drenaje deficiente. Se anticipa la acumulaciÃ³n de hasta 2 pulgadas adicionales de lluvia en la zona. Medidas de PrecauciÃ³n y Seguridad El SNM aconseja a los residentes y conductores en estas Ã¡reas evitar cruzar carreteras inundadas. â€œGire, no se ahogueâ€ es la recomendaciÃ³n, ya que la mayorÃ­a de las muertes por inundaciones ocurren en vehÃ­culos. AdemÃ¡s, se recomienda mantenerse alerta y alejarse de rÃ­os y Ã¡reas propensas a deslizamientos, ya que las orillas pueden volverse inestables con las lluvias intensas. Para reportar inundaciones observadas, se solicita a los residentes comunicarse con los servicios de emergencia locales y pedir que transmitan la informaciÃ³n al SNM cuando sea seguro hacerlo. Aviso de InundaciÃ³n Repentina continÃºa Fajardo PR, RÃ­o Grande PR, Luquillo PR hasta las 4:00 PM AST â€” NWS San Juan (@NWSSanJuan)[pic.twitter.com/vmD93fhuL8][November 1, 2024]
